David Stewart (13 December 1869 – 3 August 1933) was a Scottish footballer who played as a defender or half back.
Career
Born in Glasgow, Stewart played club football for Queen's Park, winning the Scottish Cup in 1893  by beating Celtic and also featuring on the losing side in the 1892 and 1900 finals against the same opposition. The Game.] The Scottish Referee, 14 March 1892, scan via London Hearts Supporters Club confirm these appearances (and all others from 1891 to 1894) were actually made by David and not Allan who had left the club.}} He made two appearances for Scotland.
He later moved to London where he played for Caledonians. His younger brother Andy was also a footballer whose clubs included Queen's Park.
